intro: Ituridendron bequaertii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, fiery red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rapid growth and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to gardens and landscapes.
